page.title: 12CHALLNEY HIGH SCHOOLS
page.content: The{Education Act}of 1944 raised the school leaving age from 14 to 15. In Luton there was a need for extra school buildings. In addition many new houses had been built on the outskirts of the town. To cater for these needs, 3 new schools had been built. These were{Stopsley, Icknield}and{Challney} secondary modern schools.{Challney {School}opened on the 5th September 1949. It was a site of over 38 acres. The boys school had 4 classrooms, an art room and 2 practical rooms. It also has an assembly hall which was used for dinners, assemblies and a gymnasium. The headmaster was Mr Lindley. There were four school houses,Whipperley, Havering, Someries and Woodcroft, named after manor houses in Luton.
